intro: Sterculia recordiana, commonly known as the African breadfruit tree, is a large evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces large, round fruits that resemble breadfruit, which are edible when ripe. The bark and leaves have been traditionally used in various medicinal applications. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for wildlife in its native range.
